de.wwu.muggl.ui.gui.components
Class StepByStepExecutionComposite

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control
          org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Scrollable
              org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
                  de.wwu.muggl.ui.gui.components.StepByStepExecutionComposite
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable
public class StepByStepExecutionComposite
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite

The composite for the StepByStepExecutionWindow. It offers most of its element and the corresponding methods. It heavily utilizes the supplied StepByStepExecutionRunner instance.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-08-18
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

                             throws GUIException
Set up the composite for the StepByStepExecutionWindow window.

Parameters:
parent - The windows this composite belongs to.
shell - The current Shell.
display - The current Display.
style - The style for this composite.
classLoader - The system MugglClassLoader.
classFile - The classFile the initial Method belongs to.
method - The initial Method.
Throws:
GUIException - Thrown by errors thats consequences render displaying the window useless.
Method Detail

setupInstructionListAndRefreshStates

protected void setupInstructionListAndRefreshStates(boolean simplyReloadInstructions)
Set up the instruction list and refresh fields showing the state of the executed application. This is done in an own thread so the window will not freeze.

Parameters:
simplyReloadInstructions - If set to true, just the instructions will be reloaded. It should not be used when calling the method for the first time or in order to restart the execution.

setupInstructionListAndRefreshStates

protected void setupInstructionListAndRefreshStates(boolean simplyReloadInstructions,
                                                    Method method)
Set up the instruction list and refresh fields showing the state of the executed application. This is done in an own thread so the window will not freeze. This overloaded method offers the possibility to specified the method that instructions are loaded for. It will be checked against the method retrieved from the current execution. If the current execution is busy with non-shown executions like execution static initializers, loading might be delayed.

Parameters:
simplyReloadInstructions - If set to true, just the instructions will be reloaded. It should not be used when calling the method for the first time or in order to restart the execution.
method - The method to load instructions for.

drawMessageBoxForExecutionRunner

public int drawMessageBoxForExecutionRunner(java.lang.String message,
                                            java.lang.String text,
                                            int flags)
Wrapper method for the StepByStepExecutionRunner: Show a MessageBox. If the MessageBox has a return value, provide it.

Parameters:
message - The text to display in the MessageBox' title.
text - The main text to display in MessageBox.
flags - The MessageBox flags regarding its style.
Returns:
The return value of the MessageBox.

drawInputWindowForExecutionRunner

public void drawInputWindowForExecutionRunner(Frame currentFrame,
                                              int localVariableIndex)
Wrapper method for the StepByStepExecutionRunner: draw an InputWindow to ask the user for required input regarding an unset local variable.

Parameters:
currentFrame - The currently executed Frame.
localVariableIndex - The local variable the user is asked to set.

setupExecutionRunner

protected void setupExecutionRunner()
Set up the StepByStepExecutionRunner with the basic data needed for its operation.

startExecution

protected void startExecution()
Start the execution. Therefore, the execution settings are parsed and checked. If checking is successful, the execution related buttons are disabled (the stop button is enabled of course) and the StepByStepExecutionRunner started.

startExecutionRunner

protected void startExecutionRunner()
Start the StepByStepExecutionRunner. Since the StepByStepExecutionRunner always forks to a new thread, the threading state of it is checked first. If it is a not yet started thread, its is started by invoking start(). If it is in the terminated thread, it has already finished the execution of its run() method and may not be run again. This should not happen and means that an error has occurred. Probably it was aborted but due to threading issues this access it late. In any other case, its continueExecution() method is invoked, signaling that execution might now be continued.

loadInstructions

protected void loadInstructions()
Load the instructions.

loadInstructionsByExecutionRunner

public void loadInstructionsByExecutionRunner(Method method)
Wrapper method for the StepByStepExecutionRunner: Load the instructions and format them.

Parameters:
method - The method to load instructions for.

refreshMachineStateByExecutionRunner

public void refreshMachineStateByExecutionRunner()
Wrapper method for the StepByStepExecutionRunner: Refresh the machine state.

refreshMachineState

protected void refreshMachineState()
Refresh the machine state. This means, set the method name, the local variables and the stacks of the virtual machine as well as of the currently executed Frame.

refreshSymbolicExecutionStateByExecutionRunner

public void refreshSymbolicExecutionStateByExecutionRunner()
Wrapper method for the StepByStepExecutionRunner: refresh the symbolic execution state.

refreshSymbolicExecutionState

protected void refreshSymbolicExecutionState()
Refresh the symbolic execution state. This means, set the choice points, the constraints and the coverage.

clearSolutions

protected void clearSolutions()
Clear the solutions List.

formatVMObject

protected java.lang.String formatVMObject(java.lang.Object object)
Format elements of the virtual machine stack, the operand stack and the local variables for better display, trying to provide a maximum of relevant information for the user. Some elements to not need to be formated, as they provide suitable information by themselves.

Parameters:
object - The object to format.
Returns:
A String representation of the objects' most relevant information.

setPCByExecutionRunner

public void setPCByExecutionRunner()
Wrapper method for the StepByStepExecutionRunner: set the pc.

setPC

protected void setPC()
Set the pc by painting the instruction with a blue background.

checkIfErrorOccurredByExecutionRunner

public void checkIfErrorOccurredByExecutionRunner()
Wrapper method for the StepByStepExecutionRunner: check if an error has occurred.

checkIfErrorOccurred

protected void checkIfErrorOccurred()
If an error has occurred while executing, further execution is disabled and the cause of the error will be shown to the user in a message box. Setting the field readyForNextMessage to false ensures that there is not another error risen until the message box for the current error has be drawn and was disposed by the user.

setExecutionButtonsEnabledByExecutionRunner

public void setExecutionButtonsEnabledByExecutionRunner(boolean value)
Wrapper method for the StepByStepExecutionRunner: enable or disable the buttons and corresponding elements for the actual execution.

Parameters:
value - enables the elements, while false disables them.

setExecutionButtonsEnabled

protected void setExecutionButtonsEnabled(boolean value)
Enabled or disable any buttons and corresponding elements for the actual execution.

Parameters:
value - true enables the elements, while false disables them.

editOperandStackEntry

protected void editOperandStackEntry()
Edit a value of the operand stack of the currently executed frame in the virtual machine, and refresh the machine state afterwards. The value is shown in an InputWindow and can be changed there. While the InputWindow is shown, the Shell of this composites' window is disabled.

pushOntoOperandStack

protected void pushOntoOperandStack()
Push a value onto the operand stack of the currently executed frame in the virtual machine, and refresh the machine state afterwards. The value is fetched from an InputWindow. While the InputWindow is shown, the Shell of this composites' window is disabled.

popFromOperandStack

protected void popFromOperandStack()
Pop the topmost element of the operand stack of the currently executed frame in the virtual machine, and refresh the machine state afterwards. Render a MessageBox for the user if there is no element to be popped.

emptyOperandStack

protected void emptyOperandStack()
Empty the operand stack of the currently executed frame in the virtual machine, and refresh the machine state afterwards.

changeCursor

protected void changeCursor(int style)
Change the cursor's style.

Parameters:
style - The style as an int, according to the available SWT styles for cursors.

abortExecutionByExecutionRunner

public void abortExecutionByExecutionRunner(boolean doNotStopLogging)
Wrapper method for the StepByStepExecutionRunner: abort the execution.

Parameters:
doNotStopLogging - If set to true, do not stop the logging.

abortExecution

public void abortExecution(boolean doNotStopLogging)
If an Application has been initialized, invoke the method to abort the execution.

Parameters:
doNotStopLogging - If set to true, do not stop the logging.

startLogging

protected void startLogging()
Start logging. This initializes the ArrayLists for logging and adds the Appender for displaying the messages in the StepByStepExecutionWindow.

appendLoggingStyledText

public void appendLoggingStyledText(long newLoggingEntryTimestamp,
                                    org.apache.log4j.Priority newLoggingEntryPriority,
                                    java.lang.String newLoggingEntryMessage)
Wrapper method for the StepByStepExecutionRunner: append the logging control with a new entry. The new entries are stored in an ArrayList. Due to the asynchronity of the threads running, the entries to log might be "produced" faster than they can be displayed. To avoid threading problems and to ensure, every message is actually displayed, new logging entries are appended to the ArrayList. Due to the asynchronous calls, logToStyledText() is invoked as many times as there are new entries. However, some new entries might have been gathered before the invocation of logToStyledText() starts.

Parameters:
newLoggingEntryTimestamp - The timestamp of the new entry.
newLoggingEntryPriority - The Priority of the new entry.
newLoggingEntryMessage - The message of the new entry.

logToStyledText

protected void logToStyledText()
Append the logging control with a new entry.

stopExecutionByExecutionRunner

public void stopExecutionByExecutionRunner()
Wrapper method for the StepByStepExecutionRunner: stop the execution. There are some cases where the execution is not stopped by the user but by the StepByStepExecutionRunner. This will for example have some buttons enabled or disabled.

stopExecution

protected void stopExecution()
Stop the execution: Disable the stop Button, enable the buttons for further execution and signalize the StepByStepExecutionRunner to not continue execution (for now, this is not an abortion).

getExecutionRunner

protected StepByStepExecutionRunner getExecutionRunner()
Getter for the currently instantiated StepByStepExecutionRunner.

Returns:
The StepByStepExecutionRunner.

getSolutionsList

protected org.eclipse.swt.widgets.List getSolutionsList()
Getter for the List of solutions.

Returns:
The List of solutions.

addSolution

public void addSolution(java.lang.Object solution,
                        boolean doNotFormat)
Wrapper method for the StepByStepExecutionRunner: add a solution to the list of solutions. If doNotFormat is set to true, the Object solution has to be a String and already formated for being added to the list. Otherwise, it will be formatted to extract its information.

Parameters:
solution - The solution to add.
doNotFormat - Toggles whether the object will be formated before being added to the solution list.

getInstructionLoadingComplete

public boolean getInstructionLoadingComplete()
Getter for the instructionLoadingComplete. It is used by the StepByStepExecutionRunner to find out whether the loading of the instructions (as a result of a change in the currently executed frame) has been completed. The StepByStepExecutionRunner might for example not set the pc reached in a new frame until the instructions have been loaded completely, since this pc might not even exists for the "old" set of instructions. Loading the instructions needs some analysis and might take a lot of memory due to the graphical formating, so it can take some time.

Returns:
true, if the instructions has been loaded, false otherwise.

setApplication

public void setApplication(Application application)
Set the application thats execution is controlled in this step by step execution.

Parameters:
application - The Application for this StepByStepExecutionComposite.

setStepsToGo

public void setStepsToGo(int steps)
Wrapper method for the StepByStepExecutionRunner: set the steps that are still to go. If multiple steps are executed in a row, the user will see the steps beeing counted down until they reach zero.

Parameters:
steps - The next value for the steps.
